title: Ticket #5233: Brain Dump for Karen Miller
description:
This ticket lists the flight-worthy responsibilities for Karen Miller and who will assume them once she is gone. For each item, Karen needs to make sure the new team member has received a complete brain-dump - upon brain dump being complete, please mark each item as 'Done'.

  1. (DONE) Version History before each release (TimT)
  2. Complete the documentation for each ticket. This includes adding/modifying the definition for each new/changed knob, as well as finding and editing or adding to all other parts of the manual relevant to the ticket. (?) (Karen thinks that until you replace me, this will fall on each ticket owner to complete all relevant documentation. Further, you'll want to come up with a procedure for reviewing the doc.)
  3. Edit all new/modified manual contents for spelling, grammar, and voice. (? -- must choose a victim who has writing skills)
  4. (DONE) Manual Release process (TimT)
  5. (DONE) Process for having a new major version number (TimT)
    • Note that TimT and I talked about this, and the V8_4_0-branch needs to be created (made) off the already-created V8_4-branch. If you switch the order, then all subsequent merges from V8_4_0-branch into V8_4-branch will be merging the parent branch into its child (wrong!).
    • On V8_4_0-branch
      • Add new file version-history/8-4.history.tex, with contents similar to 8-2.history.tex. Modify this file to have the right empty section for 8.4.0.
      • In version-history/history.tex, uncomment line that incorporates upgradingto8-4 file.
      • Fill in the contents to the upgradingto8-4 file.
    • On V8_4-branch
      • Merge V8_4_0-branch into V8_4-branch.
      • Modify version-history/8-4.history.tex to have a new 8-4-1 subsection.
      • Change HTCondor version within condor-macros.tex to be 8.4.1.

  6. (DONE as much as can be. Todd TJ and Lauren have source) HTCondor Week User tutorial, incl where are the "source" materials (Lauren)
  7. (DONE. Lauren Christina and Kent have source for DAGMan quick start guide.) Quick start guides, incl where are the "source" materials (Lauren)
  8. Update the manual, such that sections include current and relevant info. This includes user submission examples as well as administrator stuff such as configuration. (?)
creator: tannenba
